rename.from: Admin account can not login on ip:3000, only on Django ip:8000/admin
rename.to: Admin account can not login on ip:3000/auth, only on Django ip:8000/admin

body:
Same for me. Browser console shows: 
`Access to XMLHttpRequest at 'http://127.0.0.1:8000/v1/auth-token' from origin 'http://ip:3000' has been blocked by CORS policy: Response to preflight request doesn't pass access control check: No 'Access-Control-Allow-Origin' header is present on the requested resource.`

Same my browser console shows:
![Reason Why logging in workstation kpnnl local-3000 Niet werkt2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32341661/84519691-be0f3a00-acd2-11ea-9a57-e4891b844515.jpg)

If it instead would go to ip:8000/v1/auth-token rather than 127.0.0.1:8000/admin I think it would work logging from ip:3000/auth
Found the solution. Find all files in doccano folder that contain 127.0.0.1 with grep -R "127.0.0.1" and then replace them with "<your_ip>"
This should not be needed. Ip should be changed automatically.
I agree, however as a temporary solution you can use the method I posted above

I did what is suggested by @spacer730 and it works :)

To be more specific, the files to be changed needs to be `frontend/nuxt.config.js` and `app/app/settings.py`

I do not have so much knowledge in Django/JS so if anyone gets why this happens I'd love to know :)
Same problem. It is a huge problem for me. Please help as soon as possible.

At the end of `app/app/settings.py`, adding the IP:PORT is enough.
```
if DEBUG:
    CORS_ORIGIN_WHITELIST = (
        'http://127.0.0.1:3000',
        'http://0.0.0.0:3000',
        'http://localhost:3000',
        'http://IP:PORT' # example: 93.93.93.93:13000
    )
```

In `frontend/nuxt.config.js`, 
```
baseUrl: process.env.NODE_ENV === 'production' ? '/v1' : 'http://127.0.0.1:8000/v1'
```
should be replaced to
```
baseUrl: process.env.NODE_ENV === 'production' ? '/v1' : 'http://IP:PORT/v1' # example: 93.93.93.93:18000
```

However, in this situation, I am unable to use local website.

Confirm this issue on **development** 4927a01f090b91d8e14e467f2fd40d8301612e72's Docker Compose.

And:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1063219/86004249-b2827980-ba1b-11ea-9467-4cabe87f429a.png)

I can reproduce the problem. 

Idea
- dynamically set `baseUrl`
- fix `baseUrl` `/v1` and setup Nginx container like a production environment

Same issue happens to me.
Appreciate improvment for this amazing tool.

issue.title: Known issue about Page Access

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
**Please read this issue when you can't reach the page or faced strange navigation**  
**If you faced the following issue, please upvote üëç related issue that let us judge priority .**

- [x] Can' access the page
  - [x] [Bug report] Annotator doesn't see the project #822
  - [x]  Deployment to cloud platform (Azure WebApp / Google Cloud Run/ Heroku) causes Request failed with status code 403 #1098


### Our correspondence

1. Make clear access control by role.
2. Make a clear concept of 404/403 navigation.
3. Make a clear recovery path from 404/403 page.

issue.title: Error: Incorrect username or password or something went wrong.

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
<!-- Before submitting an issue, make sure to check the docs and closed issues and FAQ to see if any of the solutions work for you. https://github.com/doccano/doccano/wiki/Frequently-Asked-Questions -->

How to reproduce the problem
---------
<!-- Include the details of how the problem occurred. Which option did you choose to install doccano? Did you come across an error? What else did you try? -->

The problem occurred when I use "$ docker-compose -f docker-compose.dev.yml up" command to start doccano.
And there is no problem that occurred when I use "$ docker-compose -f docker-compose.prod.yml up" command to start doccano.

issue.title: login problem from remote machine

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
I install doccano using "$ docker-compose -f docker-compose.dev.yml up" command and work well on my own machine A. But when I login in doccano in another machine B, it reminds me ‚ÄúIncorrect username or password or something went wrong.‚Äù 

Your Environment
---------
<!-- Include details of your environment. -->

*   Operating System: mac
*   Python Version Used: python 3.7
*   When you install doccano: 2020/10/30
*   How did you install doccano (Heroku button etc): docker-compose -f docker-compose.dev.yml up

body:
Hi, 

Running Doccano locally on my Mac, can't log into the admin account. 
When the server comes up I get this error:
postgres_1  | 2020-11-26 13:39:09.091 UTC [1] FATAL:  database files are incompatible with server
postgres_1  | 2020-11-26 13:39:09.091 UTC [1] DETAIL:  The data directory was initialized by PostgreSQL version 12, which is not compatible with this version 13.1.

then I get a backend error saying:
backend_1   | Database unavailable on attempt 60/60: could not translate host name "postgres" to address: Name or service not known 

I tried cloning this repo into another folder and to fire up the server from the new directory and it still doesn't work. 


I keep getting this error: 
![Screen Shot 2020-11-26 at 15 48 22](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/31179968/100358474-eb407200-2ffe-11eb-9bdc-cc7f750dff65.png)


Any suggestions?

issue.title: Enable to login on remote machine

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

body: I see this has been closed, but I am getting the same error while using the latest version of the repo
